qas.question: What was the first province of northern New Spain to be explored?
Around 1528, a group of Spaniards entered the territory that now makes up what state?
The conquest of the territory lasted nearly how long?
Which tribe resisted fiercely this conquest?
The Spanish crown wanted to turn the region into what type of industry?

context: <a0_0>Nueva Vizcaya<a0_0/> (New Biscay) was the first province of northern New Spain to be explored and settled by the Spanish. Around 1528, a group of Spaniard explorers, led by Álvar Núñez Cabeza de Vaca, first entered the actual territory of what is now <a1_0>Chihuahua<a1_0/>. The conquest of the territory lasted nearly <a2_0>one century<a2_0/>, and encountered fierce resistance from the <a3_0>Conchos tribe<a3_0/>, but the desire of the Spanish Crown to transform the region into a bustling <a4_0>mining center<a4_0/> led to a strong strategy to control the area.
